Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [waiting on Pam to be done with the microwave] Ahhhhhhhhh. [whispering loudly] I'm hungry.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Movie Monday! The only cure I know for the Monday blues is... Varsity Blues!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Let's gooooo! Let's go, let's go, let's go!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [directing people to their assigned seats] Take a seat down there. Second from the end.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright, everybody here? Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [walking in with a tray of six popcorn bags] Popcorn anyone?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes pleeeeease! Thank yooouuu!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [with five popcorn bags left] Anyone else? Nooo.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Movie Monday started with training videos, but we went through those pretty fast. Then we watched a medical video. Since then, it's been half hour installments of various movies, with the exception of an episode of Entourage, which Michael made us watch six times.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Entourage!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Kevin, would you like to do the scenes from last week?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Why him?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't whine. Get the window. [Dwight exhales]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Previously on Varsity Blues...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Ok. Billy-Bob, got a head injury, but coach made him play. So then Lance, he gets sacked, he's out for the year...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [walking into an empty office because everyone is watching Varsity Blues] Hello?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Not everyone approves of Movie Monday. I won't say who.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I don't approve. I don't.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Hello? [Angela coughs and points to the conference room]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Jan walks in on Movie Monday] Hi Jan! Hope you brought the Milk Duds!

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: How would a movie increase productivity Michael? How on earth would it do that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: People work faster after...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Magically?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No... they have to... to make up for the time they lost watching the movie.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [walking past Dwight's desk] Kitchen.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Michael is going to get us all fired. You sat back and let him play that dumb movie, and now Jan is peeved off and we're all going to lose our jobs.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's not going to happen.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You know she has it out for him now.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's not his fault! He had to follow his heart!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ever since Michael dumped Jan for Carol, Jan's been bitching out on him. Reject a woman and she will never let it go. One of the many defects of their kind. Also weak arms.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Dwight, you should be running this office.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael would never let me...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It's not up to Michael, it's Jan's call. Talk to her.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I could never do that!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Fine! Sit back and do nothing and let us all get fired!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I know that patience and loyalty are good, and virtuous traits. But sometimes I just think you need to grow a pair.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: At the Stamford branch, they all play this World War II video game called Call of Duty, and they're all really into it. I'm told it started as a team building exercise. Unfortunately I really suck at it. We didn't play many video games in Scranton. Instead we'd do stuff like, uh, Pam and I would sometimes hum the same high pitched note, and try to get Dwight to make an appointment with an ear doctor. And uh, Pam called it... Pretendenitus.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [on the phone] Hey Kelly, my stuff just got here. [Kelly screams with excitement into the phone and Pam has to take it away from her ear]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Kelly really likes to online shop. Soooo, I felt like I wanted some new clothes. I mean, I just, I wanted to, it just, I felt like it was time, to maybe um... just get new clothes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [pulling her new shirt out of a box] Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [gasps] I love it!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Really? I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: You haven't even tried it on yet, try it on.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Not at work, I'll try it on--

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Fashion show! Fashion show! Fashion show at lunch!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: ...noooo

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [clapping her hands in unison] Fashion show! Fashion show! Fashion show at lunch! Fashion show! Fashion show! Fashion show at lunch!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Why did you do that?!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm just killing Germans, any way I can.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: We're on the German team. Shoot the Brittish.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [turning around to Karen] Wait, are we playing teams?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: [laughing] Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [outside in the parking lot, pacing back and forth] WAH! GAH! [breathing heavily]

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [answering the phone] Hello?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Is this Jan?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Who is this?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This is Dwight Schrute. I am calling about an extremely sensitive matter.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: You should talk to Michael, and he'll talk to me, and that way we don't have to speak to each other.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's about Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: What about him?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [exhales] I can't talk here. It's too sensitive.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: It's not about a surprise party is it?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, but we should discuss that another time.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Look, I am already an hour outside of Scranton, Dwight, I'm not coming back.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Pull over at exit 40. There is a Liz Claiborne outlet. I know you like that store. Go inside and shop, until I can meet you.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: How do you know I like that store?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Many of your blouses are Claiborne's.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: How do you know that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Part of my job.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: No it's not. It's officially not.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: ...noted.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [walking into Michael's office] I'm going... to the dentist.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I have to have an emergency crown put in.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ouchy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes. It's a new dentist. He's far. I might be gone... three hours.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Three hours, wow. Have fun. [Dwight walks away staring through the blinds at Michael]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Did you get anything good?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: New blouse? Halter top? Camisole? Teddy?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I can save the branch.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: If you let me run it.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [excitedly] "Ok" I can run it?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: What would you do differently?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Mostly get rid of waste. Which is half the people there. And clean house. [to waitress in diner] Right here. It's all for me. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Dwight, you must feel strongly, to speak with me this way, behind Michael's back, and turn on so many of your co-workers.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The decision to turn on Michael was difficult. [pouring way too much syrup on his food] But once I did it, I didn't look back. And mostly I feel that Michael would approve. It's really what's best for the branch. And I could care less about my co-workers. So [cutting his food, giving Jan a "so there" look], here we are. It's all, on the table. I want... the branch. And I await your decision.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [shoveling waffles into his mouth] Oh, by the way. There's a new Ann Taylor outlet store near here. I know you like their earrings.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [thinks for a second] Where is it?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [on speakerphone with Michael] Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I just had a very interesting conversation with one of your employees.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh. That's nice.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: No, it wasn't. Dwight just told me that he thinks he can run the branch better than you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...what?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...you were at the dentist?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: You can't have people undermining you. Get control of your branch immediately.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What was Dwight thinking? That he could turn Jan against me? She's my ex-lover! ...ish.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [Pam walks out of the bathroom wearing her new red shirt] Woooooow.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: It's so sexy. You look so hot.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: It's really something.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [smiling] It's too much.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm gonna return it.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: No, you have to keep it today, just see how you feel.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: [walking into the break room] Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: You look nice.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Isn't that like your third soda today?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah I think we can be a big help to your company. [someone dims the lights, signifying that it's game time] Ok, see you next week. Bye. [to Karen] Again?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Scared?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: [with her hands making the rocker sign] Call of Duty!

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: [sounding upset] Andy, Jim, can I see you in the conference room for a minute?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Now?

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: Yes now.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Put the game on hold everyone.

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: This is not working, ok? We are getting slaughtered out there.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It's the new guy. [looks at Jim]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, I'm sorry I don't know... what we're talking about...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: See what I mean?

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: We just need a strategy, ok? We're going to set up a trap in the gun room. All right Jim, are you using the MP-40 or the 44?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Um, sniper rifle?

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: SNIPE-

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: WHAT?

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: JIM!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Are you playing for the other team?!

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: You don't snipe in Carrington, ok?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Saboteur!

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: Andy, it's not--

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Saboteur! I'm going to kill you for real. This game-- the game is over. I'm really going to shoot you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do you want an M&M?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No thanks I'm stuffed.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No seriously. You should have an M&M, they're really good.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: ...ok. [takes and eats several M&M's]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: They're good, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: ...so good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey. I thought you weren't supposed to eat anything for a couple hours after you've had a crown put in.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: They have this new kind of quick drying bonding, so...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sounds like a good dentist.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What's his name?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [long pause] Crentist.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Your dentist's name is Crentist.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Huh. Sounds a lot like dentist.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Maybe that's why he became a dentist.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Let me see your teeth. Let me see 'em. Let me see 'em.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [reluctantly opens his mouth and Michael peers inside] Ahh. Aaaah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You should... floss.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I know...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [exhales] Well then... I am glad you're ok.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Business is like a jungle. And I... am like a tiger. And Dwight, is like a monkey, that stabs the tiger in the back with a stick. Does the tiger fire the monkey? Does the tiger transfer the monkey to another branch? [smiling] Pun. There is no way of knowing what goes on inside the tiger's head. We don't have the technology.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight, can I talk to you for a second?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [in Michael's office] Wow, this is tough.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ohhhh. Arrrgggh!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What is it?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, I just got off the phone with Jan. And um... she demoted me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. You know what the craziest part of this is? She demoted me to your job!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Gahh!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And she said that you should be expecting a call later from corporate, and that um, I guess that means that you are going to be acting manager of Dunder Mifflin, Scranton.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I can't believe this news. That-- wow.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know. I told her I didn't know whether you'd wanna do it... because you've always been so loyal to me. You've been my most trusted ally.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You said that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yep, I did. I did. But I think... you should do it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well... Gosh, if you think I should. Then I will.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [exhales] Perfect, well, we're settled.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right. Well then, you are now acting manager of Dunder Mifflin Scranton Branch, and I... am assistant regional manager.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Assistant to the regional manager. Thank you Michael, for staying on. I really appreciate it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ohh..

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey... I can't imagine this place without you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [muttering] Can't you? That's so nice.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well... I guess we should go tell the troops.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, when I'm ready, Mike. [Dwight exhales, Michael looks at the camera] Ok let's do it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, hi, hello. Everybody, I have some good news, and I have some bad news. I... am being replaced, as your leader, by Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You're kidding...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You might think that I am kidding, and I understand that.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Congratulations Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you Angela.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: But... why Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Because, Dwight... never lies.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: How does that qualify him to run a branch?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Because that's all it takes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, Dwight, would you like to say a few words to everybody... about loyalty?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you Michael. I just want to say, to the few of you who will remain under my employ, that I intend to lead you into the black! With ferocity!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Michael, what will you do?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, I'll be fine.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Do you have any savings?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, I don't, but--

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Michael, you might lose your condo.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I... won't. I won't.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I have this little vacuum cleaner that's broken. If Dwight doesn't work out, maybe that could be manager.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Maybe I'll quit.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It's really happening!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: We can make a difference here.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I, will, make a difference here.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You alone? Because I thought together we could--

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh please, don't be naive. But you can be in charge of the women.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: [whispering] Look how cute he is! He's trying to shoot with a smoke grenade.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm sorry what are you whispering about?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: I'm sorry nothing, just concentrate on turning around.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm trying--

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Just tap S then D.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: [her players gun is pointed directly at Jim's player's head] Any... last words? No?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What? [Karen's player shoots Jim's player, "You killed Jim Halpert" appears on the screen, Karen giggles]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow. Psychopath. [Karen grins widely at Jim]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I'm just looking.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Please go back to your desk.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: In a minute.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, I remember why I dress the way I do at work. But I'm gonna keep the clothes. I mean, it'll be cool to just have some after work clothes that aren't pajamas.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, I guess it's time, that I turn over the keys, to the famous Sebring.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [smiling] No thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's a corporate lease Dwight, you've earned it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Not my style.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: But you said you liked it. You've always admired it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well that was before. I'm thinking about getting something German, something with decent gas mileage. Plus, that convertible, it's a ridiculous choice for this climate.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Michael finally breaks] Take it back.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [confused] No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's my car.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What did you--

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: THAT'S MY CAR.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know, Dwight. I know. I know. I know.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know what?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jan called me about your little meeting!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know, what you did. I made the whole thing up, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I think the Sebring's cool. It's cool. The Seabring's cool. It has a cassette and it has a CD.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh do you? Do you like the Sebring-- HOW DARE YOU?! How dare you, Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Dwight gets on his knees and puts his face down on the ground] Don't fire me. Please.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Give me one good reason why I should fire you RIGHT HERE ON THE SPOT?!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [terrified] I HAVE EXCELLENT SALES NUMBERS!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Not. Good. Enough!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [sobbing] I'll do anything! Anything! I'll do your laundry for a month! For a year!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I have a laundry machine!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm sorry! I'll do anything, I swear. [squeaking, crying]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't know if I can trust you anymore.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You can't. You can't. But I promise I'll never betray you again. What can I do, Michael. What can I do? [Michael exhales] What can I do? [Dwight has his face to the ground but his butt raised high in the air] What can I do? What can I do?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You can get up. Get up. [Dwight gets up with spit hanging from his lips] And you can hug it out, bitch. [Dwight and Michael have a firm embrace]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hug it out, bitch. That is what men say to each other, after a fight. They hug it out, and doing so, the just... let it go. And walk away. And they're done. Not a good idea to say that to a woman however. I have found. It doesn't translate.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [leaving his desk for the day, pretends pull the pen out of a pretend grenade, and tosses it to Karen]

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: [throws some desk material in the air to signify debris from the grenade explosion, grins as Jim walks away]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yep. Yeah, we hugged it out. But, it turns out, I was still a little angry. So, I felt I needed to punish him, just a little bit more, [cut to Dwight standing on a box with "LIAR" written on a piece of paper hung around his neck, Dwight's head hung in shame] and I'm making him do my laundry for a year.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. [Jan leaves Michael's office; Dwight enters]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey. [shuts door] Is everything okay?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It is not your business, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: If the branch is in trouble, there are things you can do.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What do you know about management, Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I know that we need to cut costs. We could fire Meredith. That's a big cost.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm not firing anyone.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Creed might be living here, we could charge him rent.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ... What?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Four nights a week, I sleep under my desk, and then three nights I stay at my place in Toronto. They don't know about this job up there. It's a welfare state. Beautiful countries, both of 'em.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Here we go. Everybody, you know what? It dawned on me we were all in there watching a movie together before we were so rudely interrupted, Let's get back in there. [no takers] Come on. Movie Monday! Come on, Stanley let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [standing at the supply shelf] I'm on the phone.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ryan?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'm pretty sure Jan said that we're not supposed to.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, well, we had scheduled this time to watch a movie together, so I guess I will just go play some online Scrabble.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [looks to Angela]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [shakes her head disapprovingly]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The Schrutes are a very loyal breed. But I also have Mannheim blood from my German grandmother. And the Mannheims knew when to cut and run. No sense going down with a losing regime. But the Schrute blood... It's amazing that when these two bloods mix, the whole thing didn't explode.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So, she sleeps with him, but she is still in love with the head surgeon, um, the McDreamy guy, and she starts crying, but the dorky doctor, he's in love with her... [phone rings]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam. ... Uh, sure, I'll get him for you. [to Michael] It's Jan for you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I may have a few weeks ago faked a call from Jan in order to get out of a synopsis of, I think it was, Navy: NCIS. Since then, Michael's been suspicious.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Nnnnice. Wow!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [playing Call of Duty] Oh? Someone's left out in the open, taking a little siesta. Not smart. [shoots] Yes! Finally killed you... [Karen's desk is empty]

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Hey, Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, Jan.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: How's work going?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [nervously] Pretty good.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [kills Jim's character, giggles] Oh, you know what, I gotta see Josh right now, but remind me to tell you what Dwight said to me earlier, okay? You'll get a big kick out of it. [leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [baffled expression]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Things are a little bit... different here in Stamford. [shrug] It's not bad.
